CatDescriptText: Patrick J. Clayden, mechanic, South Hills and Mary Sims, hospital worker, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 23, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "What do you think is the number one problem for city officials to solve in the redevelopment program?  Why?"  Mr. Clayden's answer reads: "The lack of adequate parking facilities is the number one problem.  An example is the fact that a person who stops just a short while to go into a restaurant, gets a parking violation tag."  Ms. Sim's answer reads: "They should concentrate in the neighborhoods now, more so than downtown.  Perhaps the number one problem is the overabundance of bars and taverns."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mary Sims wearing light colored shirt dress, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Patrick J. Clayden wearing light colored polo shirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
